Question: The German philosopher Friedrich Nietzsche has been said to have taken nearly all of his political philosophy from this person.
Hints: This person conducted courses at the school for the next twelve years.
Ayn Rand accredited this person as "the greatest philosopher in history" and cited him as a major influence on her thinking.
According to this person, spontaneity and chance are causes of some things, distinguishable from other types of cause.
